sn3.25:4.2: King Pasenadi of Kosala sat to one side, and the Buddha said to him:
sn3.25:4.3: “So, Great King, where are you coming from in the middle of the day?”
sn3.25:4.4: “Sir, there are anointed aristocratic kings who are infatuated with power, and obsessed with greed for sensual pleasures. They have attained stability in the country, occupying a vast conquered territory. Today I have been busy fulfilling the duties of such kings.”
sn3.25:5.1: “What do you think, great king? Suppose a trustworthy and reliable man were to come from the east.
sn3.25:5.3: ‘Please sir, you should know this. I come from the east.
sn3.25:5.4: There I saw a huge mountain that reached the clouds. And it was coming this way, crushing all creatures.
sn3.25:5.5: So then, great king, do what you must!’
sn3.25:5.6: Then a second trustworthy and reliable man was to come from the west …
sn3.25:5.8: and a fourth from the south.
sn3.25:5.10: ‘Please sir, you should know this. I come from the south.
sn3.25:5.11: There I saw a huge mountain that reached the clouds. And it was coming this way, crushing all creatures.
sn3.25:5.12: So then, great king, do what you must!’
sn3.25:5.13: Should such a dire threat arise—a terrible loss of human life, when human birth is so rare—what would you do?”
sn3.25:6.1: “Sir, what could I do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?”
sn3.25:7.1: “I tell you, great king, I announce to you: old age and death are advancing upon you.
sn3.25:7.2: Since old age and death are advancing upon you, what would you do?”
sn3.25:7.3: “Sir, what can I do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?”
sn3.25:7.4: “Sir, there are anointed aristocratic kings who are infatuated with power, and obsessed with greed for sensual pleasures. They have attained stability in the country, occupying a vast conquered territory. Such kings engage in battles of elephants,
sn3.25:7.10: But there is no place, no scope for such battles when old age and death are advancing.
sn3.25:7.11: In this royal court there are ministers of wise counsel who are capable of dividing an approaching enemy by wise counsel.
sn3.25:7.12: But there is no place, no scope for such diplomatic battles when old age and death are advancing.
sn3.25:7.13: In this royal court there is abundant gold coin and bullion stored in dungeons and towers. Using this wealth we can pay off an approaching enemy.
sn3.25:7.14: But there is no place, no scope for such monetary battles when old age and death are advancing.
sn3.25:7.15: When old age and death are advancing, what can I do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?”
sn3.25:8.1: “That’s so true, Great King! That’s so true!
sn3.25:8.2: When old age and death are advancing, what can you do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?”
sn3.25:8.3: This is what the Buddha said.
sn3.25:8.4: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn3.25:9.2: of solid rock touching the sky
sn3.25:10.1: So too old age and death
sn3.25:11.1: There’s nowhere for elephants to take a stand,
sn3.25:11.4: by diplomatic battles or by wealth.
sn3.25:12.4: in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
sn3.25:13.4: and departs to rejoice in heaven.”
sn3.25:16.1: The Linked Discourses with the Kosalan are completed.
